title: New face for Dansk. Sans, high contrast strokes
content:
There is a thread here on the last font used by Dansk mag, but I can't find anything on the new one. Anyone has any idea? Might be a custom job, in that case, any similar?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [image.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015113037/http:/typophile.com/files/image_31.jpg) | 145.26 KB |
author: sondre m

comments.content: OK, sounds like a trend... Thanks to this [extra sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015113037/http:/danskmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/dansk/images/logo_dansk.png), I'm pretty convinced this is the same as these previous discussions ( [http://typophile.com/node/101748](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015113037/http:/typophile.com/node/101748 "http://typophile.com/node/101748"), [http://typophile.com/node/101036](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015113037/http:/typophile.com/node/101036 "http://typophile.com/node/101036"), [http://www.typophile.com/node/98738](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015113037/http:/www.typophile.com/node/98738 "http://www.typophile.com/node/98738"), [http://w.typophile.com/node/94585](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015113037/http:/w.typophile.com/node/94585 "http://w.typophile.com/node/94585")), the latin counterpart of some foreign language font such as Oriya.
